intro: Crotalaria uncinella, commonly known as the hooked crotalaria, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are typically trifoliate, with three leaflets. It has hairy stems and produces distinctive, hooked seed pods that contain small, round seeds. Crotalaria uncinella is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
